attributes.action: No future UK Govt should prevent or impede Scotland from deciding it's future.
attributes.additional_details:
The claim of right for Scotland motion:

https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CDP-2018-0171

"We, gathered as the Scottish Constitutional Convention, do hereby acknowledge the sovereign right of the Scottish people to determine the form of Government best suited to their needs."
attributes.background:
This petition seeks assurances in upholding the long held convention that the people of Scotland alone have the right to determine their future. 

It will achieve this by compelling any and all future UK Governments to permit Scotland to hold a legal, democratic vote on its future if so requested.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure exactly what you would like the UK Government to do to compel future governments to take this action.

You might like to sign this petition, which calls on the UK Government to change the law to allow the Scottish Parliament to make the decision on whether to hold a referendum on Scottish independence:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/259359
